Articles.Content:
You know that little box that comes up when you rename your vessel, that allows you to choose a classification such as Ship, Lander, Station, Rover, etc.?

I think "Airplane" should be added to the list of options. It's a small change, but for some reason I get annoyed when my spaceplane gets classified as a ship and given the "capsule" icon. Does anyone agree?

+1

Yes would be nice not to have to classify aircraft as ships.

Agreed. So much agreed.

I'd also love to have a distinction for manned versus unmanned stuff. For instance, the lander symbol looks like a manned one, and the rover symbol looks unmanned.

I'd also love to have a distinction for manned versus unmanned stuff. For instance, the lander symbol looks like a manned one, and the rover symbol looks unmanned.

This. Also while we're at it, I would like to see a symbol for ships assembled in space that never land, as opposed to the capsule symbol for smaller ships.
I support this. I would also like that "Satellite" would be added.

Thanks guys!

Personally, I think ships assembled in space would be closest to "Station", but you're right, it still doesn't exactly fit.

Also, r0cketc0der, isn't the probe symbol pretty much a satellite?

Also, r0cketc0der, isn't the probe symbol pretty much a satellite?

'Satellite' implies that the vessel isn't going anywhere, whereas a 'probe' is probably traveling somewhere. I'd love to be able to clear out my orbital networks from the viewer when shipping off my Duna lander assembly, but can't at present, because they're both 'probes.'

Heck, keep the current categories as-is, but let us color code them. Same symbol, but tinted blue for, say, vessels that you aren't planning on moving, or green for ones you need to pay attention to. Then let us hide and show those categories just like we can symbols.

Heck, keep the current categories as-is, but let us color code them. Same symbol, but tinted blue for, say, vessels that you aren't planning on moving, or green for ones you need to pay attention to. Then let us hide and show those categories just like we can symbols.

That idea is genius, sir/madam!

+1

I was actually just about to suggest this myself.

Heck, keep the current categories as-is, but let us color code them. Same symbol, but tinted blue for, say, vessels that you aren't planning on moving, or green for ones you need to pay attention to. Then let us hide and show those categories just like we can symbols.

That's a pretty good idea.

+1

I'm sure every KSP player has thought of this at some point.

I'd like to be able to pick from dozens of options for type AND for icon, and have them be separate choices.

And maybe color.

It has been suggested already and probably deserves getting suggested again. The question is, when to stop?

Out of creations I have seen and remember, things are:

- manned vs unmanned/automatic

- moving vs stationary

- with aerodynamic lift vs no lift

- in space, on ground, in water (under water?)

In general we might ask for an icon for each combination of these

manned moving no_lift space = ship

manned moving no_lift ground = rover

manned moving no_lift water = boat

manned moving lift space = spaceplane

manned moving lift ground(air)/water = airplane

manned stationary (any lift) space = station

manned stationary (any lift) ground = base

manned stationary (any lift) water = seabase

unmanned moving no_lift space = probe

unmanned moving no_lift ground = automated rover/rover probe

unmanned moving no_lift water = boat probe

etc, I'm lazy to go through them all, for some I'd probably even have problems picking a category name. And total it'd be a hell lot of icons.
Personally I think manned vs unmanned is OK. Moving vs stationary isn't a bad idea. Aerodynamic lift seems like overkill, as does "in water". We can keep it at "landed".
+1 agreed Half my craft are spaceplanes.

Kasuha makes a good point, so maybe a tag system rather than distinct vehicle classifications would work. You could have a drone spaceplane with passenger capacity with tags like [probe] [plane] [spaceship] [manned]. If modable, mods like Hooligan Labs could add [airship] and [watercraft] with appropriate icons for each.

I think we're taking all this too far, after all, the original purpose was just to add one icon

Seriously though, some of these are good ideas, but we're taking it a bit too far.
+1. I'd think aeroplane would be better than airplane though.

Here's the vessel clases I think there should be, and you should be able to change it in the VAB for each control part (So it changes properly at undock/decouple). Also, color coding?

To me this sound like: a modding interface for vessel classification.

I hate to plus one, but I'd like to see airplane/space-plane (plane would be fine) added as well.

Additionally having unmanned planes separate might be good as well.

I also like the idea of being able to mod vessel classifications.
I guess this thread died quickly

+1

There's way too little distinction yet...
I support this wholeheartedly.

It is not just a +1 for at least 3 more wehicle category should be helpful.

I do like the colorcoding (as an addition) as well.

But a little help of the possibility for the coders.

YOU ALREADY DID this with the 0.90.

Looking at the new part finder in the wab. You have a iconbase and a wonderful ability for us to make custom types (of windows)

So why not just implement it and apart from the few standard types presented right now allow us players todefine our custom ones?

Maybe as an upgrade you can make it better with the color coding too.
